```
#!/bin/bash
echo "This software is released under the GNU GPL 3 license."
echo "Anyone who uses this software must respect the terms"
echo "of this license."
echo
echo "GNU GPL 3 is a license that aims to protect software freedom." 
```

```
#!/bin/bash
cat << licensing
This software is released under the GNU GPL 3 license.
Anyone who uses this software must respect the terms
of this license.
GNU GPL 3 is a license that aims to protect software freedom.
licensing 
```

``` #!/bin/bash title="System Information for $HOSTNAME" current_date=$(date +%F) cat <<- _system-info_ > sysinfo.html $title $(uname -opr)
Updated on: $current_date _system-info_ ```

``` show_uptime() { echo "

System uptime

" echo "
"
                uptime
                echo "
" } drive_space() { echo "

Filesystem space

" echo "
"
            df -P
            echo "
" } ```

``` home_space() { echo "

Home directory space by user

" echo "
"
            echo "Bytes Directory"
            if [ $(uname) = SunOS ]; then
                    du -sh /export/home/* | sort -nr
            elif [ $(uname) = Darwin ]; then
                    du -sh /Users/* | sort -nr
            else
                    du -sh /home/* | sort -nr
            fi
            echo "
" } ```

``` open_files_root() { echo "

Number of open files for root

" echo "
"
            lsof -u root | wc -l
            echo "
" } ```

``` open_files_users() { echo "

Number of open files for normal users

" if [ $(uname) = SunOS ]; then cd /export/home elif [ $(uname) = Darwin ]; then cd /Users else cd /home fi ```

``` for user in * do if [[ $user != "lost+found" ]] && [[ $user != "Shared" ]]; then echo "There are $(lsof -u $(id -u $user) | wc -l) open files for $user. " echo "
" fi done cd } ```

``` system_info() { # Find any release files in /etc if [ -f /etc/os-release ]; then os=$(grep "PRETTY_NAME" /etc/os-release) echo "

System release info

" echo "
"
                   echo "${os:12}"
                   echo "
"
                   uname -orp
                   echo "
" ```

``` elif [ $(uname) = SunOS ]; then echo "

System release info

" echo "
"
                   head -1 /etc/release
                   echo "
"
                   uname -orp
                   echo "
" ```

``` elif [ $(uname) = Darwin ]; then echo "

System release info

" echo "
"
                   sw_vers
                   echo "
"
                   uname -sprm
                   echo "
" else echo "Unknown operating system" } ```

```
Donald-Tevaults-Mac-Pro:~ donnie$ sw_vers
ProductName:    Mac OS X
ProductVersion: 10.14.6
BuildVersion:   18G9323
Donald-Tevaults-Mac-Pro:~ 
```

```
#!/bin/bash
# sysinfo_page - A script to produce an HTML file
. /usr/local/lib/sysinfo.lib
title="System Information for $HOSTNAME"
right_now=$(date +"%x %r %Z")
time_stamp="Updated on $right_now by $USER" 
```

```
cat <<- _system-info_ > sysinfo.html
    <html>
    <head>
        <title>
. . .
. . .
    $(home_space)
    $(open_files_root)
    $(open_files_users)
    </body>
    </html>
_system-info_ 
```

```
if [[ -f /usr/local/bin/pandoc ]] || [[ -f /usr/bin/pandoc ]]; then
        pandoc -o sysinfo.pdf sysinfo.html
        rm sysinfo.html
fi
exit 
```

```
#!/bin/bash
echo "Hello. What is your name?"
read $reply
echo "What's your favorite operating system?"
read $reply
echo "How many cats to you have?"
read $reply
echo "How many dogs do you have?"
read $reply 
```

which expect

```
[donnie@fedora ~]$ autoexpect -f interactive_script.exp ./interactive_script.sh
autoexpect started, file is script.exp
Hello. What is your name?
Donnie
What's your favorite operating system?
Linux
How many cats do you have?
1
How many dogs do you have?
0
autoexpect done, file is script.exp
[donnie@fedora ~]$ 
```

```
spawn ./interactive_script.sh 
```

```
expect -exact "Hello. What is your name?\r
"
send -- "Donnie\r"
expect -exact "Donnie\r
What's your favorite operating system?\r
"
send -- "Linux\r"
expect -exact "Linux\r
How many cats to you have?\r
"
send -- "1\r"
expect -exact "1\r
How many dogs do you have?\r
"
send -- "0\r" 
```

expect eof
